page.title: 07GOVERNMENT
page.content: The people of Campden are represented on the{Parish Council }by townsfolk who live within 3 miles of the Town Hall chosen by election. The town is divided into three wards:-Upper-from the middle of the High St westwards- Lower -from the High St to the junction of Kingcombe and Aston Rd and Broad Ward covering Broad Campden. There are ten members and the Mayor. The clerk to the council has the salaried post. Meetings are held every fortnight. The public are allowed to attend but not to speak unless asked. Once a year there is a Assembly when all residents can address the meeting. The powers of the P.C. are limited to lighting,footpaths and car parks but they do have an important part to play advising the District Council on planning matters and keeping Campden from being spoilt by greedy developers
